revised_title: Insect Cases Voided by the Urinary Passage
tldr: Dr. Daniel Turner shares two cases of insects being voided through the urinary passage in infants. In the first case, a worm was removed from a 16-month-old child, and in the second case, a maggot was voided by a woman. These cases provide insight into the medical understanding of the time regarding the excretion of parasites and the role of the urinary system.
scientific_discipline: Medicine and Health Sciences > Pediatrics and Urology
